thread.title: Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series
thread.title_full: Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series

title: Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series
text:
Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series 
October 20, 2015; Chicago, IL, USA; New York Mets second baseman Daniel Murphy (28) celebrates his two run home run in the eighth inning against the Chicago Cubs in game four of the NLCS at Wrigley Field. Mandatory Credit: Kamil Krzaczynski-USA TODAY Sports Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series 
October 20, 2015; Chicago, IL, USA; New York Mets starting pitcher Steven Matz (32) is relieved in the fifth inning against the Chicago Cubs in game four of the NLCS at Wrigley Field. Mandatory Credit: Dennis Wierzbicki-USA TODAY Sports Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series 
October 20, 2015; Chicago, IL, USA; New York Mets second baseman Daniel Murphy (28) hits a double in the seventh inning against the Chicago Cubs in game four of the NLCS at Wrigley Field. Mandatory Credit: Jerry Lai-USA TODAY Sports Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series 
October 20, 2015; Chicago, IL, USA; New York Mets starting pitcher Steven Matz (32) is relieved in the fifth inning against the Chicago Cubs in game four of the NLCS at Wrigley Field. Mandatory Credit: Kamil Krzaczynski-USA TODAY Sports Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series 
Oct 21, 2015; Chicago, IL, USA; A New York Mets fans in attendance cheer in the sixth inning in game four of the NLCS at Wrigley Field. Mandatory Credit: Aaron Doster-USA TODAY Sports Mets sweep Cubs to reach World Series 
October 20, 2015; Chicago, IL, USA; Chicago Cubs third baseman Kris Bryant (17) reacts after striking out in the fifth inning against the New York Mets in game four of the NLCS at Wrigley Field. Mandatory Credit: Jerry Lai-USA TODAY Sports Reuters 
The New York Mets completed a four-game sweep of the Chicago Cubs in the National League Championship Series with an 8-3 rout on Wednesday that put them into the World Series for the first time since 2000. 
The loss meant the young, hard-hitting Cubs would have to wait at least one more season to carry the frustrated franchise back to the Fall Classic, which they last played 70 years ago.
